alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milton, Bagdad, Roeville, Point Baker, Pea Ridge, Ward Basin, Pine Bluff, Indian Ford, Broxson, Harold, Galt City, Parkerville, Harp, Mulat and Munson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
